page.title: 13Local History
page.content:
"Great Brickhill,Little Brickhill And Brickhill with the Bow, There stand the three Brickhills, All in a row."
This local rhyme reminds us that there are three Brickhills."Brickhill with the Bow" at the time of our survey had a population of approx.670. The old name for this village was "Bolle Brichelle".Brichelle meaning hilltop and Bolle being formed from Boel the name of a family associated with the village in the 12th century. The village has developed on either side of the B557 road linking Bletchley with Woburn Sands.Villagers all agreed that the most noticable change to their lives over the past 10 years has been the coming of the new city of Milton Keynes.
